summary: If checked baggage is lost, the airline is liable for damages up to 1,288 SDR. Baggage is considered lost if not delivered within 21 days.
Airlines are liable for damages caused by delayed baggage unless they took all reasonable measures to prevent the delay.
Airlines are liable for damage to checked baggage if the damage occurred while the baggage was in their care.
Airlines are liable for damage caused by flight delays if passengers suffer financial or consequential loss due to the delay.
Airlines are liable for death or bodily injury of passengers during international flights unless they prove no negligence.
article: Article 17 – Injury or Death of Passenger

summary: The limit of liability for delay, baggage, and injury is 1,288 SDR for baggage and 113,100 SDR for injury/death unless higher declared value is proven.
Passengers must submit a written complaint within 7 days for damaged baggage and 21 days for delay or loss.
article: Article 31 – Time Limit on Baggage Claims

summary: Any legal action for compensation must be brought within 2 years from the date of arrival or when the aircraft should have arrived.
The passenger must prove the occurrence of delay or damage. The airline must prove it took all necessary measures to avoid the damage.
